intro: Depanthus glaber, commonly known as the smooth depanthas, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright, sparsely branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, sandy or loamy soils. Depanthus glaber is often used in native plant gardens for its ecological value and ornamental appeal.
